history.content: No, as long as less than 1/3 of your total units are p/np by graduation you are fine.

Based on today's notification about the P/NP change for 16B, I was leaning towards switching to P/NP-ing the course. At present, I'm taking 13 units (1 of which is for a PNP 1 unit class). If I were to convert 16B to PNP, I would have 5 PNP units and 8 graded units this semester. 
Is there a limit on how many (or a limiting ratio on) units that I can PNP in a single semester?

Thanks!
history.subject: Question about PNP units per semester / EECS16B

history.content:
I'm a L&S CS Major and I'm taking EECS 16B right now. Based on today's notification about the P/NP change for 16B, I was leaning towards switching to P/NP-ing the course. At present, I'm taking 13 units (1 of which is for a PNP 1 unit class). If I were to convert 16B to PNP, I would have 5 PNP units and 8 graded units this semester. 
Is there a limit on how many (or a limiting ratio on) units that I can PNP in a single semester?

Thanks!
